summary: This document is a response from the New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services to an FBI request for a search of records, indicating that the records can be obtained through the Interstate Identification Index using the appropriate NCIC transaction. It appears to be part of an information-sharing or record-checking process related to an investigation.

persons.name: Michael C. Green
persons.role: Executive Deputy Commissioner of the NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services
persons.context: He is listed as the sender or responsible official for the New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services in this correspondence with the FBI.

events.title: DCJS Response to FBI Inquiry
events.description: The New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services responds to an FBI request for a search of records, indicating that the records can be obtained through the Interstate Identification Index via NCIC transaction.

locations.name: Alfred E. Smith Building, 80 South Swan St., Albany, New York 12210
locations.context: Address of the New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services.

locations.name: New York
locations.context: Location of the FBI New York office and the state agency involved.

keyFacts: The FBI New York office made a request to the New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services for a search of records.
The response indicates that the requested records can be accessed through the Interstate Identification Index using the appropriate NCIC transaction.
The document is dated October 6, 2021, showing ongoing investigative or record-checking activity related to the Epstein case years after his death.
